cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 180 mi ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across the Yucatan, then turning northwest to north toward the northern Gulf Coast (Louisiana).

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect (future watches expected for northern Gulf Coast Wednesday)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Tulum to Dzilam, Mexico.  Tropical-Storm Warning: Pinar del Rio (Cuba) and eastern Yucatan coast.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from upper Texas coast eastward through Louisiana-Mississippi-Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤9%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusty squalls possible late Thursday–Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (likely <2 ft) possible, but significant surge (>3 ft) not expected for Corpus Christi.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–2 inches of rain Thursday night through Friday; widespread heavy totals not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased seas, long-period swells and dangerous rip currents along south-Texas beaches beginning late week.
